blog.name: seldnei
blog.title: It's Not The End Yet. Let's Stay With It.
blog.description:
"Wordsmithery, Eloquence, and Smarmy Grace"

Hi, I'm Laura (and this is appearing on my blog as I type it, that is--to quote Oz--fairly freaksome).

Tumblr is where I get my geek girl on and reblog gifs of adorable stuff I think my kid would like to see. If you're interested in my writing, I have a blog over at WordPress with links to my publications, plus somewhat regular word-making-activity.

tags: things that make me laugh like a loon
summary: Good Omens’ Michael Sheen Is Fandom’s New Boyfriend
body:
Good Omens’ Michael Sheen Is Fandom’s New Boyfriend

Some choice quotes:

“A month ago, I might’ve said that Sheen was an unlikely pick to be dating the entirety of the Internet … But Sheen’s nuanced and thoughtful embodiment of Aziraphale in the Amazon Prime Video adaptation of Good Omens means that he crossed a sort of fandom cultural Rubicon. He’s ours now. We are all in a budding relationship with Michael Sheen.”

But hold up, what about his co-star?! Well …

“There’s certainly no lack of love for Sheen’s co-star David Tennant, who plays the demon Crowley with flair and panache, but the Internet has dated Tennant before.”

(Look, I, for one, am happy to be part of an enormous polyamorous relationship with Michael Sheen, David Tennant, and the entirety of the Internet.)

summary: Good Omens’ Michael Sheen Is Fandom’s New Boyfriend
body:
Good Omens’ Michael Sheen Is Fandom’s New Boyfriend

A month ago, I might’ve said that Sheen was an unlikely pick to be dating the entirety of the Internet. With a storied stage and screen career that stretches across the decades, he’s the kind of prestige performer you expect to see showing up in award show profiles, not the latest meme.

But Sheen’s nuanced and thoughtful embodiment of Aziraphale in the Amazon Prime Video adaptation of Good Omens means that he crossed a sort of fandom cultural Rubicon. He’s ours now. We are all in a budding relationship with Michael Sheen.

But Sheen’s nuanced and thoughtful embodiment of Aziraphale in the Amazon Prime Video adaptation of Good Omens means that he crossed a sort of fandom cultural Rubicon. He’s ours now. We are all in a budding relationship with Michael Sheen.

But Sheen’s nuanced and thoughtful embodiment of Aziraphale in the Amazon Prime Video adaptation of Good Omens means that he crossed a sort of fandom cultural Rubicon. He’s ours now. We are all in a budding relationship with Michael Sheen.

</br></br></br></br></br></br></br>Sylien or Charlie - 25 - Denmark - enby they/them - queer - neurodivergent

This blog is multifandom, occasionally NSFW, and I'm an intersectional feminist, anti-capitalist, virtue signalling cultural Marxist SJW and whatever other words you want to throw at anyone who is even vaguely left-leaning.
I'm a Critter, a Marvelite, a DM and a gamer.
</br>
These days I'm using all my spare time playing Dungeons and Dragons.

summary: michael sheen was the white rabbit in alice in wonderland which also came as a huge shock to me
question: michael sheen was the white rabbit in alice in wonderland which also came as a huge shock to me
answer: Yeah I looked it up on IMDB and saw that he was unfortunately in alice in wonderland. I’m just sad about it because now I’m gonna have to sit through a johnny depp movie. It’s bad enough that I was already going to have to watch passengers and deal with chris pratt and jennifer lawrence for him.

tags: the only good part of passengers
summary:
The internet's reaction to discovering Michael Sheen after Good Omens is hilarious and heartwarming. 
Tons of people watched for...
body:
The internet’s reaction to discovering Michael Sheen after Good Omens is hilarious and heartwarming.

Tons of people watched for David Tennant and were blindsided by this hot welsh professor type, who loves equal rights and acts on a lot of weird nifty things.

Welcome to the only good Sheen train you hoes. I’ve been here for years.

reblog.comment:

tags: i didn't watch the other underworld movies
rise of the lycans looked too actiony for my taste
summary: Shit actually how old was I when I watched Underworld? Was I 14? I didn't see it in the cinema but I definitely got fandomy...
body:
Shit actually how old was I when I watched Underworld? Was I 14? I didn’t see it in the cinema but I definitely got fandomy about it in GCSE drama class…

I know I did a presentation in Welsh on Michael. Everyone else was doing like, rugby players and the Stereophonics.

It led to my Welsh teacher teaching me the word “olygus”…

reblog.comment:
